title: Wireless Retail Sales Representative
description:
AT&T Retail Wireless Sales Associates – Hiring Immediately – No Bonus Caps!

Blue Link Wireless LLC

Blue Link Wireless is proud to be one of the fastest-growing AT&T Authorized Retailers in the country, and we’re just getting started! In our first year, we grew to over 220 locations in 21 states and have become one of the largest AT&T Retailers, and we want you to join our growing team!

Retail Sales Associates are the cornerstone of the retail experience, serving as the face of the Blue Link Wireless and the AT&T brands. You’ll be responsible for demonstrating the wide array of products, services, and entertainment options available to our customers, creating personalized solutions for every person that walks through the door!

We’re always looking to bring on best-in-class team members, which is why we offer some of the best-in-class compensation and benefits in the wireless retail space! Full-time Retail Sales Associates can earn from $25,000–$30,000 + up to $20,000 in commissions yearly if all sales goals are met. Not to mention all the other amazing rewards that working at Blue Link Wireless offers. Individual starting pay within this range may depend on geography, experience, expertise, and education/training. Top full time Sales Associates have exceeded $65,000 in a year and some have been promoted to Store Leaders within that year as a result! Commissions are based on sales and performance goals set for a given market.

In addition to excellent compensation, we also offer great benefits, perks, and advancement opportunities! Many of our Area Sales Leaders started out as Store Leaders, and many of our Store Leaders started out as Retail Sales Associates. Join us at Blue Link Wireless to start paving your own path!

Blue Link Wireless AT&T Retail Wireless Sales Associate Benefits & Perks:

A competitive base rateThis position is Non-Exempt and is eligible for overtime pay.Commissions on every sale you make with no commissions cap! Company paid training. A 50% discount on AT&T service for up to 10 lines! Employee discounts on accessories and equipment! Sales contests and spiffs! Up to $500.00 RAMP UP Bonus for new hires. Up to $75.00 in AT&T clothing vouchers! A $200.00 bonus for every person you referred that works through the 120 days Blue Link Wireless New Hire period. Generous Benefits package including a 401K program. Amazing medical plansDental coverageVision coverageLife and AD&D company paid for those on the medical plan.Voluntary supplemental Life and AD&D for you and your family.Voluntary short-term disabilityVoluntary long-term disability. Access to the Alliance Protect Plan. This includes 24/7 doctor access via tele-doc, global emergency services like prescription services, medical consultation, emergency medical evacuation, emergency roadside assistance and much more. Excellent career development and growth opportunities 


Wireless Retail Sales Associate Duties & Responsibilities:

Interacting with customers and providing prompt and courteous customer service to all customers Understanding customers' needs and helping them discover how our products meet those needs. Educating and engaging customers through product demonstrations Possess a competitive spirit and desire to meet and exceed sales goals. Stay current with the latest data/entertainment technology and devices, such as Wi-Fi, data devices, TV entertainment tools. Multi-task in a fast-paced team environment Attaining monthly goals and objectives Ability to work in other locations as the needs of the business dictate. Completing all aspects of opening and closing the store in accordance with written procedures Submitting all transaction journals daily Assisting with inventory maintenance 


Wireless Retail Sales Associate Qualifications:

1-3 years retail/customer facing/sales experience preferred but not required. Bilingual preferred but not required in some markets.Competitive and eager to learn! Sales Associates are paid a competitive hourly rate and can earn additional monthly commission dollars by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives! Desire to exceed customer expectations and a love of wireless technology. Ability to work evenings, weekends, and/or holidays as reflected on a published and approved schedule. 


Blue Link Wireless is primed for success; our founders have extensive and acclaimed experience in the wireless communications sector. Every member of our executive team is driven towards growth, and a desire to attract the friendliest, most knowledgeable team members to build our success one guest interaction at a time.

We are committed to training, promoting, and retaining our most valued resource, our team members. With Blue Link’s trajectory for growth, the potential for career advancement for top performers within our organization is unprecedented.

Blue Link Wireless is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding/lactation, and related medical conditions), age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, military/veteran status, and any other characteristic under applicable federal, state, or local law.

Blue Link Wireless provides modification/reasonable accommodation to disabled individuals to assist in the hiring process and to qualified individuals with disabilities in the performance of essential job functions, as required by federal, state, and local law. A reasonable effort is also made to accommodate the religious needs of employees. Any individual seeking modification/accommodation to apply for Employment or to participate in the application/interview process should contact Human Resources.

title: Senior Software Engineer, Full-Stack
description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced software engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of full-stack development, as well as experience leading a small team. The successful candidate will be responsible for the development of ad technology applications and services.
About the team:Walmart's Advertising Technology group enables the connection between supplier brands and retail shoppers at unprecedented scale. We are a highly motivated group of engineers and data scientists, working in an agile group to solve sophisticated and high impact problems. We serve billions of ads requests every month with our high-performance ad servers.
There are millions of customers shop on Walmart websites and in stores daily, and advertising helps advertisers bring the best products to our customers. If you want to influence millions of customers on their shopping journeys, we have a role for you.
What you'll do:Solve complex software systems problems by leveraging state-of-the-art technology.Gain exposure to various emerging technologies used in Marketing and E-commerce platforms.Provide technical direction, architecture leadership and expertise to the team.Lead by example. Show your chops as an exceptional and experienced developer.Drive projects of high visibility across the organization.Participate in medium- to large-scale, complex, cross-functional projects by reviewing project, product and business requirements; translating requirements into technical solutions; gathering requested information (for example, design documents, product requirement); designing robust and scalable architectures; writing and developing code; conducting unit testing; communicating status and issues to team members and stakeholders; collaborating with cross functional teams; troubleshooting open issues and bug-fixes; enhancing design to prevent re-occurrences of defects; ensuring on-time delivery;
What you'll bring:4+ years of experience designing and building scalable and reliable front-end and back-end services and applications, with experience in a tech-lead role.Strong full-stack development experience; front-end experience with JavaScript/ReactJS. Back-end experience developing RESTful APIs that use RDBMS or NoSQL storage systems.Strong expertise in development of scalable cloud native microservices, designing and building APIs.Strong expertise with Cloud Technologies like Azure and GCP.Strong expertise in Java and JavaScriptExtensive knowledge of open-source libraries, design patterns and micro-service architecture. Familiarity with CI/CD and unit testingExperience in production system operations (logging, telemetry, alerting etc.)A keen eye for detail and desire to learn, win, collaborate, and relish a challenge.
About Walmart Global TechImagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.
Flexible, hybrid work:We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.
Benefits:Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.
Equal Opportunity Employer:Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers, and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting, and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas, and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.
The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.
Base Salary Range: $117,000 - $234,000Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:Stock equity incentives

title: Category Growth Manager
description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY Founded in 1888, Lee Kum Kee, a Hong Kong-based global food company, specializes in creating condiments and sauces that promote Chinese cuisine worldwide. With more than 200 products to choose from, Lee Kum Kee takes the mystery out of cooking authentic and delicious Asian foods in the comfort of your kitchen. Lee Kum Kee is committed to providing authentic and innovative condiments and sauces featuring the highest quality ingredients. Armed with a unique management culture, stringent quality control, superb and innovative products, coupled with the century-long brand reputation, Lee Kum Kee has achieved unanimous recognition and won numerous prestigious awards.Lee Kum Kee (USA) Inc., a division of Lee Kum Kee International Holdings Ltd., has its headquarters and manufacturing facilities in Southern California with more than 300 employees. We are looking for the best and brightest talents to join our company and work together to bring the next level of success!
BENEFITSMedical, dental, life insurance covered by the company401(k) retirement plan with company matchTwo (2) weeks vacationsTen (10) paid holidays
The Manager, Category Growth is accountable for the category growth and portfolio development for the Americas Zone; ensuring an integrated business plan to deliver N5Yr objectives and all product category penetration targets.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSReasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.· Category Strategy Formulation and Portfolio Management Shape, inspire and develop the long-term category vision and responsible for related category growth KPIs.Identify key customer targets in both retail and foodservice business segments with a futuristic perspective. Translate data and insights to category strategic initiatives and innovation pipeline development that deliver sustainable category growth and build brand saliency.Develop, write, test and optimize customer-centric product proposition and marketing concepts that capture a compelling relevant promise to increase penetration, market share position and enhance customer engagement.Build, shape/streamline, deliver an effective category portfolio in collaboration with internal functional experts. · Communication Development Develop Americas Zone’s category playbooks (adapting from global category playbooks), including product portfolio factbooks, communication kits, packaging/ label and PFA guidelines, to establish consistency across all market segments.Partner with marketing communication team to ensure the consistent deployment of product stories and contents across all market segments.Partner with local sales teams to implement marketing campaigns, events and promotion programs. · Innovation & Renovation Lead new/ revamped Zone NPD development in line with global innovation process; from insight generation, ideation to product business case development, financial forecasting, pricing, P&L structure and recommend in-market execution strategy with close partnership with Finance, R&D, manufacturing, local sales and channel marketing and other cross-functional teams. · Marketing Community Representation Work closely with channel marketing teams to define and achieve the common goal of the categories. Drive the buy-in and engagement from the sales channels to facilitate smooth roll-out.Represent Americas Zone in the Global Marketing community for the respective categories to ensure that needs are heard and supported. Share global best practices for local consideration. · Effective Resources Management Control A&P spending allocated to respective category within the budget and maximize cost efficiency of investments with a clear measurement scheme.Support sales channels in planning and implementing category marketing research programs related to building “physical availability”.Perform other duties as assigned. COMPETENCIESProblem SolvingDrive for ResultsManaging & Measuring WorkBuilding Effective TeamsMotivating Others SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIESThis position does not have immediate supervisory role yet. It will be required to supervise subordinates when the team expands as the business continues to grow. Supervisory responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; career planning for the team and addressing complaints and resolving problems and etc. QUALIFICATIONSTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
A. REQUIRED EDUCATION, SKILLS and EXPERIENCE· Bachelor’s degree in marketing or business administration. MBA is strongly preferred. · Minimum 7 years of sales/marketing experience in reputable FMCG food/beverage organizations with 2 years in managerial position.· Knowledge and experience in new product development and category management.· Strong strategic and analytical thinking with solid “CAN-DO” attitude. · Demonstrate judgement to define category development towards company goal. · Pursue innovation and change with a mindset of continuous improvement.· Excellent leadership skills to drive non-reporting teams to work toward the common goal.· Exceptional ability to develop and cultivate strategic relationships.· Strong presentation, organization, and time management skills.· Ability to organize, set priority, manage and measure work. · Ability to make timely decisions, handle multiple projects, work under pressure, meet all deadlines and be flexible in work schedule.· Ability to work within an integrated operating enterprise, coach peers and teams in executing complex programs, deal with ambiguity and conflict management.· A team player to drive company goal and core value.· Ability to motivate others, build effective teams, direct others. · Proficient in MS Office including Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.· Good understanding of financials and budgeting process.· Willing to travel as needed. This position requires up to 25% travel; most travel is outside the local area and overnight. Some of the travel may be international. B. LANGUAGE SKILLS· The individual must be fluent in English· Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills; ability to communicate clearly, accurately and with impact.· Fluency in Chinese (verbal and written) is a plus. C. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS· Must be able to apply statistical & mathematical concepts to perform all related activities.· Ability to add, subtracts, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.· Must be able to compute rates, ratios, and percentages and draw and interpret bar graphs.  D. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.· Regularly required to use hands and fingers to handle or feel objects, tools or controls; and/or reach with hands and arms.· Required to stand, sit, kneel and walk while performing essential job functions.· Occasional lifting and/or moving up to 50 pounds (e.g. moving products, supplies, materials or samples). 
It is Lee Kum Kee’s policy to seek and employ the most qualified persons in all jobs in a manner which will ensure equal employment opportunity as well as administer personnel actions in a manner as to not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability or protected veteran status. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

title: Regional Sales Manager - San Diego
description:
Our Regional Sales Managers are responsible for generating loan application volume through various programs by developing and maintaining key contractor client relationships. They are responsible for developing and implementing training, marketing, and support strategies for our HVAC, Solar, Windows/Doors, Roofing and Energy Efficiency contractor clients so that they will in turn drive product engagement and homeowner acceptance to accomplish/exceed loan application goals. 
The right candidate for this position has a proven ability to build and foster strong client relationships by understanding our client’s business and effectively and seamlessly integrating our products and tools into the client’s sales process. He/she is an enthusiastic and talented sales trainer, who is committed to the success of the client, as well as Renew Financial’s financing programs. 
Essential Responsibilities  
Pursue and sign up contractor clients in your region for Renew Financial’s various financing programsDevelop field marketing plans for clients to support business goals, and support implementation of contractor marketing strategies.Support client team initiatives and attend/support client trade events.Develop, customize, and conduct client trainings.Develop RF awareness programs on a regional level in support of clients.Drive application volume to meet/exceed goals - measured as percent increase to Op Plan. Exceed customer satisfaction by meeting/exceeding established Client Satisfaction survey target goals. Audit client communication and marketing materials for compliance purposes and communicate issues accordingly. Support and collaborate with Programs, Operations, and Marketing staff to ensure best in class client tools, support, and programs.Other responsibilities may be assigned.
Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor's degree, and/or 3+ years' experience working in the Financial Services HVAC, solar, Energy Efficiency and/or home improvement industries. Minimum of 3 years of Field sales and Client Relationship Management experience. Minimum of 2 years' Experience making presentations to all levels of management. Proficiency with MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Excellent verbal and written communication skillsProven ability to establish lasting business relationshipsProven ability to successfully share skills and knowledgeStrong understanding of consumer finance productsWilling to travel up to 80% of the time; a valid Driver’s license is required.

title: Practice Manager - Emergency Medicine Administration
description:
Overview

IU Health Physicians is the most complete, multi-specialty practice group in Indiana. Comprised of a comprehensive network of primary care and specialty physicians, IU Health Physicians is proud to call Indiana home. If you are searching for a chance to use your expert knowledge to improve the lives of patients and their families, IU Health, has the career opportunity you are looking for! 

IU Health Physicians is currently seeking an innovative leader, who is inspired by challenging and meaningful work for the good of every patient. This Practice Manager will be administratively focused, completing operational tasks for the success of 3 regional emergency departments. This manager's home-base will be located in Lafayette, IN. If you are looking to grow in your career, driven by compassion and excellence, and feel a connection to this purposeful work, apply today!

At IU Health, your personal and professional growth is a top priority. You will have access to many diverse opportunities to learn and develop in meaningful ways that matter most to you, such as training, leadership development, promotion opportunities and cross training development.  We offer a comprehensive benefits package designed for you, which includes Medical-Dental-Vision, a matching 401K, PTO, tuition reimbursement program, wellness program, and more!

The Practice Manager is accountable for directing and facilitating many aspects of management for the patient care staff in order to deliver efficient, effective and quality patient care. Assists the Director in planning, directing and overall operations within their areas of responsibility. Provides the day to day supervision in assigned patient services areas, financial management and facility adequacy of their assigned areas. Maintains optimal communication and collaboration between practice staff, physicians, external customers and appropriate health system staff to ensure service delivery that exceeds the needs and expectations of customer bases towards service excellence.

REQUIRES 5 -7 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN A RELATED FIELD

 High school diploma or GED required. American Heart Association Basic Life Support (BLS) Healthcare Provider Certification required Requires knowledge of Third party payer regulations. Prefer a Master's degree in Health Care Administration or a Bachelor's degree in Business, Management or health care related field with a minimum of 2 years of concurrent management experience within an ambulatory/physician practice setting. At least three years of prior experience in a business office and clinical setting with management experience is preferred A minimum of 6 years management experience in an ambulatory/physician practice setting in lieu of degree or a combination thereof may be accepted

title: Factory Automation Site Sr Manager
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your commitment and detailed attention toward safe and repeatable space flight. Join us in lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth.

Our team is looking for outstanding, highly motivated, solution development leaders who love listening to our customers, working as a team, and proactively taking the lead whenever vital. Our mission is to innovate and build scalable and robust hardware and software solutions in the manufacturing environment. These solutions drive the delivery of Blue Origin rockets and systems. Participate in the design, implementation, and deployment of pioneering systems and technologies to continuously improve the safety, quality, and efficiency of our manufacturing processes. Functionally decompose sophisticated problems into simple, straightforward solutions. Share knowledge in performance, scalability, enterprise system architecture, and engineering standard methodologies.

We are looking for someone to apply their expansive controls engineering expertise, leadership skills, and dedication to quality to scale and improve automated manufacturing at Blue. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Responsibilities

Lead initiatives to improve the reliability and efficiency of manufacturing processes through automation; own and drive the technical architecture, roadmap, and implementationCollaborate with data-science and analytics teams to pair control system development with IOT analytics, developing closed-loop data-driven enhancements to sophisticated manufacturing systemsOversight of electrical design and modification of industrial control and safety systemsLead the design and modification of PLC and Robot programsEnsure design compatibility with current data collection solutionsSupport the development of SCADA applications (Ignition, Kepware, AWS, etc.)Oversight of the production support function for sophisticated manufacturing equipment

Qualifications

3+ years experience in engineering leadership of a multi-functional team of automation professionals6+ years experience with common automation software development languages (ex. Ladder, ST, C/C++)6+ years experience with controls and automation software development environments (ex. Siemens TIA Portal, Allen Bradley Control Logix)3+ years experience with 'from scratch' software development used in automated tooling or equipmentA demonstrated ability to interpret and review electrical and mechanical drawingsStrong skills in design and process simplificationAbility to communicate optimally, clearly, and with humility to partnersAn understanding of world-class quality, attention to detail, and dedicationAbility to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and strengthen our culture of inclusionMust be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Desired

B.S. degree or higher in Mechanical, Manufacturing, Mechatronics, Electrical, Controls, or other relevant engineering fieldFamiliar with various control system and equipment safety standards such as IEC 61131, ANSI B11, NFPA 79, and RIA 15.06Experience with writing and developing software in a high-level language such as Python or C#.Experience with NC programming of automated systems such as G-code, TP, KarelExcellent technical writing, grammar, and presentation experienceExperience with electrical verification of machinesExperience in defining, implementing, and maintaining control code from source controlHands-on experience with multiple common manufacturing and assembly processes, CNC machines, metrology systems (laser tracking), and inspection

Inclusivity Statement

Don’t meet all desired requirements? Studies have shown that some people are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single desired qualification. At Blue Origin, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every desired qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Export Control Regulations

Applicants for employment at Blue Origin must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (i.e. current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum.

Benefits

Benefits include: Medical, dental, vision, basic and supplemental life insurance, paid parental leave, short and long-term disability, 401(k) with a company match of up to 5%, and an Education Support Program.

Paid Time Off: Up to four (4) weeks per year based on weekly scheduled hours, and up to 14 company-paid holidays.

Discretionary bonus: Bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results.

Eligibility for benefits varies by role type, please check with your recruiter for a comprehensive list of the benefits available for this role.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Blue Origin is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to attracting, retaining, and developing a highly qualified, diverse, and dedicated work force. Blue Origin hires and promotes people on the basis of their qualifications, performance, and abilities. We support the establishment and maintenance of a workplace that fosters trust, equality, and teamwork, in which all employees recognize and appreciate the diversity of individual team members. We provide all qualified applicants for employment and employees with equal opportunities for hire, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment, regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin/ethnicity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local law. title: Lunar MK1 Flight Operations Integration Lead
description:
At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight! 

At Blue Origin, we envision millions of people living and working in space for the benefit of Earth. We’re working to develop reusable, safe, and low-cost space vehicles and systems within a culture of safety, collaboration, and inclusion. Join our diverse team of problem solvers as we add new chapters to the history of spaceflight!  

This role is part of Lunar Permanence mission operations, which develops the mission operations systems, training and procedures that support Blue Origin’s multiple Blue Moon lander product lines. To further Blue Origin's mission of having millions of people living and working in space, we are building sustainable infrastructure for our transport of crew and cargo from Earth to the lunar surface. 

As the MK1 Flight Operations Integration Lead, you will directly support the Director of Mission Operations by leading the technical integration of all mission operations elements of our MK1 lunar lander spacecraft. You will work with the mission operations teams such as training, operations product development, ground software, mission systems engineering, and others to set priorities, establish schedules, create efficient business processes and set the technical baseline for MK1 operations. You will represent the mission operations team at programmatic boards and reviews and recommend changes to vehicle designs or concepts of operations to improve operational efficiency and safety. You will track operational risks and regularly report on schedule, budget and technical issues along with recommendations for resolution.

We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and commitment to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required!

Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To

Set priorities and establish schedules for the development and execution of mission operations for the MK1 class of lunar lander vehicles Review and approve engineering and operational product changes for both the lander vehicle and ground systems Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, including engineers representing flight vehicle systems, ground software, flight control operators and customers Assist with establishing standards for repeatable and cost-effective mission operations execution, working to continuously improve team performance and create a culture of operational excellence Maintain the mission operations section of the programmatic Integrated Master Schedule Represent mission operations at programmatic reviews and staff meetings Develop mission operations plans and standards for MK1 class missions Train and certify to support mission operations from our mission control center(s) Support anomaly response teams as needed 

Minimum Qualifications

Minimum: BS Degree in Mechanical, Aerospace, or related Engineering field. 10+ years experience conducting spacecraft operations 2+ years of experience leading flight operations teams Ability to work in a fast-paced operational environment and make high-consequence, rapid decisions with potentially incomplete information Excellent written and verbal communications skills Ability to earn trust, maintain positive and professional relationships, and contribute to a culture of inclusion Must be a U.S. citizen or national, U.S. permanent resident (current Green Card holder), or lawfully admitted into the U.S. as a refugee or granted asylum. 

Preferred Qualifications

Experience utilizing Agile methodologies Familiarity with Jira, Confluence and other project management software tools Cost account management experience Demonstrated track record of working with cross-functional teams to make technically sound decisions and establish productive working relationships Experience with risk management Prior experience developing one or more of the following: spacecraft/satellite ground systems, spacecraft operational procedures, spacecraft training programs, mission planning systems Knowledge of orbital mechanics Familiarity with spacecraft communication standards using satellite relay and/or ground stations

title: Content Production Specialist
description:
Who We Are 🌍

Manychat is a leading Chat Marketing platform. We help businesses engage with their customers on Instagram, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, and Telegram.

Trusted by over 1 million brands in 170+ countries, we're an official Meta Business Partner, backed by top investors, including Bessemer Venture Partners.

With 150+ teammates across international offices in Austin, Barcelona, Yerevan, São Paulo, and Amsterdam — Manychat helps businesses across the globe improve their ROI and grow faster.

title: Brand Manager
description:
A born and bred San Francisco original, Hotaling & Co. is the leading distiller and importer of artisanal spirits and cocktail essentials. Our dedication to artisanal spirits first started 30 years ago under the name Anchor Distilling Company - heralding the return to copper pot distilling in the U.S. with the original craft introductions of Junipero Gin & Old Potrero Straight Rye Whiskey. We carry on that pioneering legacy with the name Hotaling & Co. as a nod to the local legend A.P. Hotaling, who ventured West during the Gold Rush and quickly became one of the most reputable spirits dealers in the country and a notable figure in American drinking culture. Fueled by a passion for beverage expertise, education and hospitality, Hotaling & Co. carries on this tradition of artisanal excellence by bringing together a family of likeminded spirits that share our commitment to craft and care.

Today, Hotaling & Co.’s portfolio is synonymous with brands of unmatched quality and character, including Luxardo Liqueurs & Cherries, Nikka Whisky, Junipero Gin, HINE Cognac, Convite Mezcal, Severo Tequila, Kavalan Whisky, Denizen Rum, HIRSCH Selected Whiskeys, Writers' Tears Whiskey, Old Pulteney Whisky, Speyburn Whisky, Balblair Whisky, Arran Whisky, Old Potrero Rye Whiskey, and more. Visit www.HotalingandCo.com to explore our full range of brands.

Job Details

Reports to: Vice President of Owned Brands

This position is hybrid and requires working from the office in San Francisco Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays.

Potential relocation assistance available

Salary range: $110,000-$150,000 based on experience.

Job Description

Seeking a Brand Manager (BM) responsible for Hotaling and Co. American Whiskey Brands, Hirsch Selected Whiskeys and Old Potrero Rye Whiskey, a pivotal role in our growth. Collaborate cross-functionally to execute brand strategy, manage agencies, and go-to-market initiatives. Drive brand equity while managing brand budgets. Lead marketing, sales support, and people development efforts.

Key Responsibilities Execute comprehensive brand strategies for our American Whiskies portfolio to achieve volume and profit targets.Lead the planning and execution of marketing initiatives, including product launches, trainings, distiller tours, events, promotions, social and digital marketing, and advertising campaigns, aimed at increasing brand awareness and market share.Have a deep understanding of the whiskey category, stay informed on trends, consumer preferences, and competitor activities and communicate with the team.Work closely with cross-functional teams including innovation, operations, finance, sales, and portfolio marketing to achieve brand goals.Provide clear execution direction to the Sales Organization and partner in focus markets to execute local initiatives.Oversee relationships with marketing agencies, ensuring effective collaboration and delivery of marketing campaigns.Manage brand budgets, invoice processing, and vendor relationships to ensure efficient financial management.Foster relationships with distributors and retailers to support sales initiatives in key markets.

What we're looking for... A bachelor’s degree preferred in business, marketing, or related fieldMust have 5 years of working experience, preferably in brand management within the beverage alcohol industry.Strong analytical, communication, and project management skills.Acute attention to detail.Proficient in market research and data analysis.Able to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.Comfortable with ambiguity and able to problem solve while working cross-functionally.Self-starter with a high tolerance for multi-tasking and flexibility that thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.Positive “can do” attitude with a growth mindset.Proficient in Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and WordBroad time commitment, including some nights and weekends.

Travel up to 20% of the time.Passion for American Whiskies and a deep appreciation for the craft.

Why work at Hotaling & Co.

Number one, hands down… the people and the brands are unparalleled!

Great benefits: medical, dental, vision, FSA, 401k with match, generous commuter benefits, life and AD&D, STD, LTD, Employee Assistance Program.

Other goodies: Educational Assistance Program to further your knowledge and prepare you for the next step, weekly catered lunches, monthly happy hours, quarterly employee outings, annual National Company Meeting, paid parental leave, sick and vacation hours, 12 holidays a year, volunteer hours, Buy Your Own Booze program to help you get acquainted with our brands. PandoLogic. Keywords: Brand Manager, Location: San Francisco, CA - 94151

title: Commercial Electrical Apprentice - Hurlburt Field
description:
Job Title: Commercial Electrical Apprentice

Location: Hurlburt Field FL

Pay: $25 per hour

Schedule: Monday-Friday 8am-5pm

MUST BE ABLE TO PASS REQUIRED CHECKS TO OBTAIN MILITARY BASE ACCESS. 2+ YEARS EXPERIENCE AS AN APPRENTICE REQUIRED

Position Summary: Electrical Apprentices are individuals undergoing training to become skilled electricians. They work under the supervision of experienced electricians and are responsible for assisting in the installation, maintenance, and repair of electrical systems. This role involves hands-on work, learning technical skills, and following safety protocols.

Key Responsibilities:

Assist in Installation and Maintenance: Work alongside experienced electricians to install, repair, and maintain electrical systems, components, and equipment.Follow blueprints, technical drawings, and specifications to ensure accurate and safe installations. Conduct Wiring and Connections: Assist in running wires, connecting circuits, and ensuring proper electrical connections in residential, commercial, or industrial settings.Learn to troubleshoot and identify issues in existing electrical systems. Compliance with Electrical Codes: Familiarize oneself with local, state, and national electrical codes to ensure all work meets regulatory standards.Follow safety guidelines and protocols to prevent accidents and ensure a secure working environment. Use of Tools and Equipment: Gain proficiency in using various hand tools, power tools, and testing equipment commonly used in the electrical trade.Keep tools and equipment in good working condition and report any issues promptly. Collaboration and Communication: Work effectively as part of a team, taking direction from experienced electricians and communicating progress and challenges.Interact professionally with clients, ensuring excellent customer service. Continuous Learning: Attend training sessions, workshops, and classes to enhance knowledge of electrical systems, new technologies, and safety practices.Stay updated on industry trends and advancements. Adherence to Safety Protocols: Strictly adhere to safety procedures and guidelines to prevent accidents and injuries.Report any unsafe conditions or practices to supervisors. Documentation: Maintain accurate records of work performed, including installation details, repairs, and any modifications made to electrical systems. Qualifications and Requirements: High school diploma or equivalent.Enrollment in an accredited electrical apprenticeship program.Basic understanding of electrical concepts and principles.Strong mechanical aptitude and problem-solving skills.Ability to work at heights and in various weather conditions.Physical fitness and manual dexterity.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Willingness to learn and follow instructions. Benefits: Weekly Pay, Long Term Opportunity, Medical Benefits

How to Apply: Interested candidates are invited to submit a resume and cover letter outlining their qualifications for consideration.

title: Machine Operator 2nd Shift
description:
Machine Operator2nd Shift Location: Hanover, PAShift: 2nd (3PM

11PM)Full Time, USW OpportunityUS Citizenship is Required

About SKF:SKF has been making the world spin since 1907! SKF is an industry-leading manufacturer dedicated to a culture of belonging, where our people flourish in an equitable environment that promotes leadership development and career growth. SKF bearings played an integral role in helping Mars Rover collect rock and regolith samples on the planet’s surface.

As an SKF team member, you will join 40,000 colleagues from more than 130 countries developing bearing technology and services that make rotation more reliable and sustainable. Sustainability is at the heart of everything we do. SKF aims to have net zero greenhouse gas emissions at all our production facilities by 2030.

SKF products keep vehicles rolling, power the machines that put food on your table, and even reach into the cosmos as part of the Mars rover mission. Founded in Sweden in 1907, today SKF is publicly traded on the Nasdaq Stockholm with annual sales in 2020 of approximately $10 billion.

In Hanover, PA we produce Rings and Seals for the Aerospace and Industrial markets. Extreme product range fragmentation, complex product design, very high-quality standards and traceability requirements are the peculiarity of our Business Unit. We are looking to hire a Machine Operator to work 2nd Shift (3PM

11PM). All hourly employees will be part of the United Steelworkers Union (USW). Due to the nature of the work, US citizenship is required.

Role Responsibilities include and are not limited to: Follow all plant safety rules and procedures.Follow all 5S and Lean manufacturing principles.Read and understand blueprints, sketches, and process sheets.Perform machine set-up and operation.Utilize gages and tooling within the department for set ups and operations.Make fixtures as needed.Assist with experimental production and trial production parts for engineering.Use calipers and micrometers.Work within tight tolerances per production routers.Assist others in developing methods and procedures.Set-up machines for General Operators.May be required to wash rings and dip in protective coating.Perform preventative maintenance function within work cell.Communicate with department lead and supervisor on regular basis.Use of a variety of instruments and tools such as face grinder, mills, manual lathe, internal grinder and outside diameter grinder, micrometer/caliper, etc.

Job Requirements: Due to the nature of the business, candidate must be a US Citizen.High School Diploma or GED required.Ability to understand verbal and written instructions.Flexibility with work hours during training period.Ability to stand for 8-hours per day, 5-days per week.Ability to lift 35-pounds (anything over 35-pounds will use lift assist or team lift).All hourly employees will be part of the United Steelworkers Union (USW).Requires continuous attention to operations.Ability to read and understand blueprints, sketches, and process sheets.Ability to make fixtures as needed.Ability to use calipers and micrometers on a daily basis.Confidence in working within tight tolerances per production routersManufacturing operator experience a plus.

What You’ll Love About SKF:Rest and Relaxation. Enjoy a robust vacation policy and 14 paid holidays!

SKF Celebrates Diversity in the Workplace! We actively develop ourselves and our teams to enable outstanding delivery. We trust the strength of diverse teams and encourage agile ways of working.

Health and Wellness Benefits. SKF cares about the wellbeing of our employees. Many options for best in class medical and dental plans to fit your needs, and a wellness plan. Health and welfare benefits begins on the 1st of the month following 30 days of employment.

Invest in your Future. SKF offers amazing retirement options! Participate in our 401K program that boasts a 3% of all eligible 401k earnings contribution (100% Vested after 1 year of service).

SKF Cares! The four fundamental cornerstones of SKF Care – Business, Environment, Employees, and the Community are critical for us to sustain long-term success.

Much more! Growth opportunities, voluntary critical illness coverage, voluntary legal plan, employee assistance program, life insurance, vehicle discount programs, mobile phone discounts, and with so many benefits to working for SKF, we could not name them all!Reports to: Production SupervisorLocation: Hanover, PAJob ID: 19694SKF provides equal employment [and affirmative action] opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.By applying to this job you acknowledge how SKF treats candidate data. Click HERE to review the SKF Data Privacy Consent Statement. PandoLogic. Keywords: General Machine Operator, Location: Hanover, PA
